column4: What does ubuntu have like Picasa's ability to create a CSS driven photo album.. I've got some shots I'd like to throw up on some spare web space and don't want to mess with CMS
I was looking at that but you need to be running your own server right? or have it on a linux based server?
you asked what ubuntu has.  so yes.  linux server.  but it doesn't have to be your own.  a lot of admins like gallery and might even be running it already

this is a unique situation.. just personal web space provided by my isp (10gigs) to throw individual pages up.. I think it's on a windows server.  Picasa will build a nice css driven page to display a folder of pics.. simple stuff
ok, and picasa exists for linux, and windows.  so there you go, i think?
yea.. I was resisting.. gwenview will do it but it pulls in a boat load of kde dependancies.
also there are a few simple gallery/thumb generator scripts for linux that will make a dir you can zip up and sned over to that server
lemme check for a couple, i was playing with some last night til i settled on gallery2 (for its rich featureset and being able to add pics on the fly)
photon, webmagick, and lazygal had reasonable results
sure are, they come right up on an apt-cache search gallery
thanks.. probably just what I was looking for.. simple direct ..one off type stuff.  thanks!

yep.  i do believe webmagick was the one that i could just specify a directory full of pics and a thumbnail size, and it made the thumbs, generated the page, and put it all in an easy to deploy package
